prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Our scientific objective is to detect the submm continuum emission. A default setup is fine.
All targets are compact sources. Any baseline configuration would be sufficient.

We propose to observe four LMXBs at Band 7 and 9. Since jet emission is supposed to have a flat or slightly inverted spectrum, we estimated the exposure time based on radio observations (e.g., Fender & Hendry 2000). We aim to achieve an rms of 0.1 mJy and 0.3 mJy for Band 7 and Band 9, respectively. GRS 1915+105 is known to have 350 GHz emission between 3-30 mJy (Ogley et al. 2000). Sco X-1, GX 13+1, and GX 5-1 have never been observed in submm.
Our scientific objective is to detect the submm continuum emission. A default setup is fine.
The target is a compact source. Any baseline configuration would be sufficient.

We propose to observe four LMXBs at Band 7 and 9. Since jet emission is supposed to have a flat or slightly inverted spectrum, we estimated the exposure time based on radio observations (e.g., Fender & Hendry 2000). We aim to achieve and rms of 0.1 mJy and 0.3 mJy for Band 7 and Band 9, respectively. Only GRS 1915+105 has been detected up to 350 GHz. All sources have never been detected at the frequencies of Band 9.
Our scientific objective is to detect submm continuum emission. A default setup is fine.
All targets are compact sources. Any baseline configuration would be sufficient.

Sco X-1, GX 13+1, and GX 5-1 have never been observed in submm.
Our scientific objective is to detect the submm continuum emission. A default setup is fine.
All targets are compact sources. Any baseline configuration would be sufficient.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose to conduct the first submm study of persistent low-mass X-ray binaries (LMXBs) with ALMA. LMXBs are known to have radio emission because of jet outflows. Since the spectrum of jet emission is expected to be flat or inverted. Submm emission from jet is expected and this study will allow is to investigate the spectral break location which is expected to be between submm and IR.

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Institute of Astronomy, National Tsing-Hua University
